name: ClipDrop by Codex Solutions
title: ClipDrop by Codex Solutions
description: How to integrate ClipDrop with Make.com

children.text: Clipdrop is an AI-powered platform for creating, editing, and enhancing images. Integrating it with Make.com enables automated image processing workflows, boosting productivity for users needing fast, high-quality visual content manipulation across various applications.
This is AI-generated content based on official ClipDrop documentation. The content may still contain errors—please verify important information. If you have questions, contact
How to get support on ClipDrop

ClipDrop is a community-developed application and is subjected to the developer's terms and conditions, which may include applicable fees. Make does not maintain or support this integration. For assistance, please https://f.make.com/r/reachout?app_name=ClipDrop&app_slug=clipdrop-community&app_unique_id=clipdrop-co-mh29fv.
To use the ClipDrop app in Make,
you must have an active account and an API Key,
To install this app, you need Admin, Owner, or App Developer permissions.
the on-screen instructions to complete the setup.
To get started, you must first create a connection between ClipDrop and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
You can connect using the following method: API Key.
You need to obtain your API key.
Login to your platform using your credentials.
If your API key has leaked, revoke it and request a new one from your account page.
If you do not have an API key, contact support to request one.
Some community developers require an additional specific
from the community developer's dashboard, generally found under
, add the ClipDrop module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your ClipDrop or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection. You must also enter any required third-party API keys obtained earlier.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the ClipDrop app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Effortlessly removes unwanted objects or imperfections from your photos, helping you enhance and clean up your images with ease.
Creates a sketch-style drawing from the image file you provide, transforming your photo into a hand-drawn look.
Easily convert any photo of your object into a polished, professional product image, automatically adding a realistic shadow for a high-quality finish.
Generates a brand new image based on the detailed prompt you provide.

Certainly! Here’s the rephrased answer and the image prompt:

**Rephrased Answer:**  
This module lets you automatically send a personalized message to a specific Slack channel or user. It’s perfect for sharing updates, notifications, or reminders with your team directly from your Make.com scenario.

**Image Prompt:**  
A simple, friendly illustration showing a computer screen with the Make.com logo, connected by an arrow to a Slack chat window. The Slack window displays a new message notification, with a smiling character on the side, representing an automated workflow sending a message.
Allows you to make a custom, authorized API request to the connected service, giving you flexibility to access features or endpoints not covered by the standard modules.

Generate new versions of your images that are similar in style or content, but with some differences. This module helps you create alternative images based on your original, allowing for creative variety while maintaining a consistent look.
Removes the background from your uploaded image, leaving only the main subject visible.
Removes unwanted text from an input image, helping you clean up pictures by erasing any visible words or characters.
Swap out the background of your photo and place the main subject into a completely new environment.
Creates additional image content by expanding the edges of your input image, generating new visual extensions beyond the original borders.
Generates a higher-quality, upscaled version of the image you provide, improving its resolution and overall appearance.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
